p: The SARS-CoV-2 virus is transmitted mainly via respiratory droplets [ 9]. Nearly 90% of children with COVID-19 were believed to have been infected via close contact with family members or community exposure [ 10]. Current data indicate that infected children are not themselves a major source of transmission. This is in contrast to influenza, where children have played an important role in the transmission to household contacts and are important drivers of epidemics in the community [ 11, 12].
